description: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications.
releaseNotes:
Aspose.Slides for .NET 14.2.0 Release Notes
We are pleased to announce the release of Aspose.Slides for .NET 14.2.0. This release includes several enhancements and many bug fixes.
Using Aspose.Slides for .NET you can work with PPT, PPTX, OpenDocument, and other formats in your applications. You can also view, generate, modify, convert, render and print presentations all without using Microsoft PowerPoint.
Visit the documentation to learn how to get started with Aspose.Slides for .NET.
Note this download contains a fully working version of the product, however without a license set it will run in evaluation mode. To test Aspose.Slides without these evaluation limitations you can request a free 30-day temporary license.
The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Slides.
Minor Features
  (SLIDESNET-35029) - Support for Clearing / Updating a Hyperlink in the new merged API of Aspose.Slides for .NET
  (SLIDESNET-35037) - Design and implement API for manage OverrideTheme object
  (SLIDESNET-35020) - Implement dual signing
  (SLIDESNET-34898) - Support numbered and unnumbered list styles when importing paragraph text from HTML
Other Improvements and Changes
Bugs
  (SLIDESNET-35187) - Attempt to import slides from the HTML results in NRE
  (SLIDESNET-35171) - Export PPTX to HTML with Images in JPEG format
  (SLIDESNET-35166) - NullReference Exception on accessing presentation
  (SLIDESNET-35165) - Found a shapes with identical IDs Exception when accessing presentation
  (SLIDESNET-35148) - PPT StypeTextPropAtom reading issues
  (SLIDESNET-35143) - System.FormatException is thrown when presentation with chart is opened
  (SLIDESNET-35141) - WriteToSVG cuts the text after Ampersand sign
  (SLIDESNET-35132) - System.ArgumentException is thrown when AddDataPointFor... methods are called
  (SLIDESNET-35129) - NullReferenceException is thrown when presentation with chart is saved
  (SLIDESNET-35104) - SVG Image is not showing up in the generated PPTX file from HTML
  (SLIDESNET-35097) - NullReferenceException is thrown when the presentation is saved to PPTX
  (SLIDESNET-35095) - Saving a PPTX presentation results in a broken presentation
  (SLIDESNET-35091) - The font color is changed from white to black in generated PDF
  (SLIDESNET-35090) - Improper pptx->html converting
  (SLIDESNET-35079) - StackOverflowException while Pptx to Pdf saving
  (SLIDESNET-35078) - Importing HTML Text in PPTX is not working fine
  (SLIDESNET-35074) - ArgumentoutOfRangeException when importing HTML text with lists
  (SLIDESNET-35061) - Fix regression on TC
  (SLIDESNET-35056) - Changing the angles in setLinearGradientAngle doesn't have an effect.
  (SLIDESNET-35044) - Exception "Input String was not in correct format" thrown on opening the PPTX file
  (SLIDESNET-35031) - Text with underline effect rendering issues
  (SLIDESNET-35023) - NullReference Exception on accessing presentation
  (SLIDESNET-35012) - missing text in SmartArt for exported PDF
  (SLIDESNET-35010) - PPTX Exception thrown "Input string is not in correct format"
  (SLIDESNET-34993) - NullReference Exception on accessing presentation
  (SLIDESNET-34975) - Strike-through line is missing for text in generated PDF
  (SLIDESNET-34940) - Text disappearing after conversion from PPT to PDF
  (SLIDESNET-34912) - PPTX to PNG: SmartArt Text shows upside down in generated PNG file
  (SLIDESNET-34909) - KeyNotFound Exception on accessing presenation for cloning in using merged API
  (SLIDESNET-34878) - PPTX to HTML (SVG) export is incorrect
  (SLIDESNET-34865) - AutoShapes get corrupted when PPT presentation is exported to PDF
  (SLIDESNET-34253) - The strike through text effect is missing in generated HTML
Known Issues and Limitations
There are several known bugs, which appear during some presentations processing.
  (SLIDESNET-35151) - Wrong chart outline PDF and PNG rendering
  (SLIDESNET-35149) - PPT to PPTX conversion creates corrupted presentation
  (SLIDESNET-35147) - IndexOutOfRangeException is thrown when presentation with chart is loaded
  (SLIDESNET-35146) - PPTX to PDF conversion issues
  (SLIDESNET-35138) - Shape shadow is not present in thumbnail
  (SLIDESNET-35134) - Chart is corrupt after presentation cloning
  (SLIDESNET-35133) - PPT DocumentProperties.HiperlinkBase property read/write issue
  (SLIDESNET-35128) - Chart properties read/write operations issues
Public API and Backwards Incompatible Changes
Methods Aspose.Slides.IPresentation.Write(�) are removed
These methods wrote Presentation objects only to PPTX format file. In new API, the Presentation class is for working with all formats. It is possible to use Presentation.Save(�) methods for saving Presentation objects to all supported formats.
Classes related to theme styles are moved to Aspose.Slides.Theme namespace
Types ColorScheme, EffectStyle, EffectStyleCollection, EffectStyleCollectionEffectiveData, ExtraColorSchemeCollection, ExtraColorSchemeCollection, ExtraColorScheme, FillFormatCollection, FillFormatCollectionEffectiveData, FontScheme, FontSchemeEffectiveData, FormatScheme, IColorScheme, IEffectStyle, IEffectStyleCollection, IEffectStyleCollectionEffectiveData, IEffectStyleEffectiveData, IExtraColorScheme, IExtraColorSchemeCollection, IFillFormatCollection, IFillFormatCollectionEffectiveData, IFontScheme, IFontSchemeEffectiveData, IFormatScheme, ILineFormatCollection, ILineFormatCollectionEffectiveData moved from Aspose.Slides namespace to Aspose.Slides.Theme namespace.
Changes from Aspose.Slides for .NET 8.0 .. Aspose.Slides for .NET 8.4 are added to Aspose.Slides for .NET 14.2.0
summary: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications. It allows you to open files and manipulate the elements of the presentation from adding slides and managing variety of shapes and working with text to more complex elements like presentation protection, slide animations, charts and SmartArt rendering.The presentations can be exported to PDF, TIFF, XPS, SVG, PNG, JPEG, BMP or EMF formats.
title: Aspose.Slides for .NET
